description: Site of an ancient settlement that flourished between the seventh century BCE and the early sixth century CE, located west across the Tiber from the modern village of Attigliano in Italy. Piammiano is probably to be identified with "Statonia", which is mentioned in ancient sources.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: probably Piammiano

properties.description: Convex hull around features included in Leucci 2021, Figure 2. Georeferenced against OpenStreetMap features in QGIS. Dates after Leucci 2021.
properties.title: GIS Location: Known Settlement and Cemetery Extent

history.comment: fixed erroneous direction indication in summary

New locations, coordinates, and metadata from Harvard's DARMC project. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceUpgradesAndMigrations
Detail text updated from former modernLocation. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceDetailsUpgrade
